content.question: In Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> , an engine that delivers power <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is attached to a pulley that lifts a box of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> a vertical distance of <math alttext="y sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at a constant speed in time <math alttext="t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. If, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> the engine again delivers power <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, how long would it take the engine to raise a box of mass <math alttext="3 m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> the same vertical distance <math alttext="y sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at a constant speed?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of 3, times t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
